author: {'steamid': '76561198031631176', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1477548182}
review:
Здравствуйте, друзья! В этот тёплый весенний день позвольте мне поделиться с вами некоторыми моими мыслями и эмоциями касательно данной визуальной новеллы, и, не тратя больше времени, начнём:
I. С самого начала мне следует обозначить для вас два важных положения относительно Starlight Vega, а именно то, что игра полностью на английском языке, и о переводе пока ни слухом ни духом (я во всяком случае), это раз, и два - это юри-новелла, что подразумевает возможность завести главным героем-девушкой романтические отношения  с персонажами исключительно женского пола (других тут практически и нет). Итак, прояснив основополагающие моменты, двигаемся дальше.
II. По моей маленькой традиции начну с рисовки, как с визитной карточки, "лица" любой новеллы. Она мне понравилась практически во всех моментах: CG, BG, спрайты - всё справлено на ура, с душой, чувствуется, что художник подошёл к своему делу с большой охотой и старанием. Радует большое разнообразие эмоций у спрайтов и множество CG. Единственная даже не то чтобы ложка дёгтя лично для меня, это то, что в рисовке спрайтов чувствуется некая ... неловкость что ли, скромность. А может мне просто креститься надо. 
III. Сюжет вначале может показаться тривиальным: главная героиня вместе со своей мамой получает в наследство старинный дом. Вскоре после въезда во время осмотра дома Ария (ГГ) вместе с подругой обнаруживает таинственную комнату, полную древних фолиантов и странных предметов. Героиня дотрагивается до одного из них (а может не дотрагивается? выбор ваш), и с этого начинаются её приключения. Должен признать, что сюжет меня завлёк, и вёл до самого конца, и в этом заслуга качественно прописанных диалогов, истории, и стиля написания в целом, но не только. Об этом далее.
IV. Музыкальное сопровождение. Очень понравилось, музыка подобрана точно в тему, будь то ситуация или персонаж (да-да, у персонажей есть темы). Бывало, что во время чтения я останавливался просто для того, чтобы послушать звучащую композицию, вот такой бонус к погружению она даёт. Надо будет поискать отдельно.
V. Цена. Вот то, что как ничто другое отваживает людей от приобретения этого произведения в обычное, нераспродажное время. Скажу за себя, совсем не хотел брать даже с 10-процентной скидкой, однако взглянув на скриншоты и отзывы, перекрестившись купил. Не пожалел, как видите, а впрочем и так никогда не жалею. Однако ваши кошельки - это ваши кошельки, и решение тоже ваше. Я поддержал разработчика, и рад этому.
VI. В заключение хотелось бы сказать, что оценок я ставить не собираюсь, однако РЕКОМЕНДУЮ эту новеллу всем любителям и не только, и помните, что это моё личное мнение, у вас же обязательно сложится своё, и это замечательно! До встречи в следующих обзорах!

review:
One of the few rare lesbian visual novels that are already translated, or in this case made for a english audience. 

The Art is interesting, very much a western style, though admittedly it appears that the person who drew the standard interaction CGs and the one who does the more intimate ones was totally different. The latter being far more high quality, which is not necessarily a bad thing, but it can get a bit distracting. I imagine this had something to do with more funding. 

Overall the story is fairly simple and choices in the game do make a impact on the various endings you get, and even make sense in most ways in terms of how they turn out. Unfortunately the love scenes are fairly short and the nudity is lighthearted, seemingly designed for either for all ages or tastefulness as some people might say. 

Still quite a good read and recommended to anyone who's into visual novels and particularly those that like Yuri.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031295529', 'num_games_owned': 460, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1078, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1078, 'last_played': 1461408522}
review:
If you have any amount of interest in yuri, buy this. Yes, it's worth the full price of $15 USD. Just buy it.


Starlight Vega is a fairly light hearted love comedy with LOTS of yuri in it. Just subtext? No! This is 100% bona fide yuri with love confessions, kissing, and PG-13 love scenes. (I would still not play this in front of your parents.) Art-wise, it's adequate enough. It's not bad, just adequate. Soundtrack is enough to set the mood. A single run through can easily be done under 7 hours depending on how fast you read. A complete run with old scene skipping took me 12 hours for all endings. Now for the nitpickings.

[u][b]There MAY be some slight spoilers. Read the next paragraph at your own discretion.[/b][/u]





PLOT

[u]Almost 4th ending exclusive:[/u]

There are definitely moments of [i]"it's magic I ain't gotta explain shit"[/i] going on. Sometimes there are story transitions where it may feel a tad forced. This becomes pretty apparent in the unlocked ending with the way the antagonist is disposed of. Wait a gosh darn minute, we had such a pain in the rear time dealing with this twerp in every other route and all of a sudden it's [spoiler]Persona style All Out Attack on the jerk. All of a sudden everyone but the MC just figured out the quickest way to get rid of curse was to beat the living undead shit out of a malevolent spirit. What da hell?[/spoiler] You girls just reconcile out of the blue ridiculously quickly. For one thing, Scherza's [spoiler]abandonment issue[/spoiler] was only really addressed in Lyria's route where she finally learned [spoiler]what really happened 50 years ago.[/spoiler] Even in Scherza's route, she's one heck of an ice queen to woo. The only times Aria really ever interact with Scherza one on one was [spoiler]in a dream when they haven't been kidnapped to Vega.[/spoiler] There have been instances where she does talk with Aria in a more private fashion, but nothing as deep as whatever happened in Scherza's own route enough for Scherza to get romantically interested in Aria...? To sum it up, the 4th ending just seems to parachute in from out of nowhere. There ARE attempts at trying to make this work, but the progress at how we arrived at this point just seems loosely held together by... [spoiler]harem[/spoiler] anime logic. Yes, Kickstarter incentive and etc. I really enjoyed it but it could've done with more polishing.

[u]Choices[/u]

Yes, there are choices. Choices that easily dictate which route you are going to end up on and some do seemingly absolutely nothing. For all the choices, I wish at there are things I can do more of. Ok, the bracelet in the study. It was briefly brought up and [i]never[/i] heard from again. Could've been funny if that was somehow used. The whole thing between Lyria and Scherza was unfortunately only properly addressed in Lyria's route. Aria has no say whatsoever regarding what actually transpired even though she may have come across the diary and whatever Lyria told her. She has 0 influence whatsoever as a main character and I find that very unfortunate as I do want the two of them to get along. 

[u]Characters[/u]

I adore the characters: Aria, Melody, Lyria, Scherza, and Rhihannon. I'm tempted to say Aria has some issues as a MC, but I've seen much worse performance from otome games so I guess she got [i]just[/i] enough done. I feel for Melody, a lot. She really got the shaft in not her endings. Such a good trooper and super friend. Lyria is just Lyria, fairly straight forward. Scherza is a slight mixed bag due to her behaviors in her own route and whatever happened in the 4th ending. The antagonist is... weeeeeaaaaak. Not enough build up.[i] OOoooh, sinister silhouette. That should totally be enough to give it away.[/i] Not quite. I want to dig in into whatever happened back then. It's all just he says vs she says. Seriously, was it really as bad as it was thought or was there enough room for different interpretations? Scherza does paint the situation different than what was described by everyone else. More plot points please.



The story definitely had a few hiccup points, but overall it holds together well enough for me to gloss over the minor pitfalls it have. Would I recommend this to anyone interested in yuri game? Absolutely. I would try to sell this to anyone who's open to a light hearted visual novel. I got great milage out of it.




More nitpicks
I need more save slots though. There just isn't enough for every choice in every route. 
Please check your grammar and spelling again. There are definitely a few mistakes. I think there is also some coding issue in the special thanks section where someone' name shows up as 4 rectangles... I get there are a LOT of people who donated in the Kickstarter, but that's quite the speed at which you are scrolling...
Not everyone plays visual novel on a daily basis. Nowhere was it mentioned that CONTROL key equals fast forwarding. Interface is already incredibly bare boned and could do with that option instead of relying on the keyboard.
Some bugs with the CG not saving properly in the gallery.

review:
Starlight Vega is about a girl named Aria. She just moved in to her grandfather's old house along with her mother. Her best friend Melody accompanies her for the night. There they come across a demon, who was trapped in a jewel, named Lyria and an old spell book belonging to her grandfather. They discover that there is a whole other world named Vega, were demons and magic is common place. I don't want to spoil anything so I won't say anymore about the story. 

This is a GxG game. Aria gets to romance Lyria, the sultry demon, Melody, her best friend, and Scherza, a mysterious woman she meets in her dreams. After you complete the game you get the harem route where you can go out with all three of them.

It took me around 6 hours to get through (I skipped read text). So it's not that long.

The overall story is interesting. It has its surprises and you do want to know what is going to happen next but I did feel like the resolution for the problem in Vega was resolved in a very anti-climatic way. Like it just gets solved so easy. I was like, “that's it?”. I also felt like some routes just kinda ended. Also, some of the stuff that happens with Aria's grandparents could have been a bit more in depth. I just wanted to know more about them and what exactly happened in the past that lead to the current events, but that's just my personal opinion. Game does give enough info to get the gist of it.

The actual character routes that dealt with the romance were well done. There's some conflict between the characters that makes things more interesting. In each route you learn something new about the overall plot and everything is revealed little by little as you play all three routes. The harem route seems more like an extra.

To get each character route you are given choices. Some lead to bad endings but it's not that difficult to figure out what you did wrong. I was able to get through this game and get all the achievements without a guide. Just save when there is an important choice.

My favorite character was Scherza, I just like those types of cold characters that warm up as the story goes. At first, I didn't like Lyria much but as I played other routes I also ended up liking her too. I liked Melody too and some parts in her route made me feel bad for her. Aria takes a while to realize things. I liked all the characters, even Sid (who seemed annoying at first but I really liked that little guy as I got to know him better).

The CGs are all well drawn except for one that seemed unfinished like they forgot to finish coloring it or something. It's not big deal but it did bother me a bit. The sprites do look different from the CGs but they are fine, well except that Lyria looks older than in her CGs. There are adult scenes but nothing explicit there is an age verification for reason for this page though. As for the backgrounds, some are more detailed than others. 

I did spot some spelling errors but nothing that heavly distracts from the overall reading experience.

Overall, it's a great game and I recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081430111', 'num_games_owned': 2542, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1463378217}
review:
[h1] Starlight Vega is a yuri visual novel. It allows you to make some choices here and there that guide you towards a particular ending, but otherwise you'll be spending your time reading--which is fine, because the story is engaging and complex.  [/h1]

.Story.
It's so difficult to comment on this without spoiling anything, so I'll just say that it's cute and fluffy at times, raunchy and suggestive at others. There's political intrigue, humour, fantasy/magical elements, supernatural elements like ghosts and other realms, combat, romance, non-explicit limes... The list goes on. I imagine there's something here for everyone, especially if you're a fan of reading. 

There were only a few typos, which I greatly appreciated. Thank you for your level of polish, Starlight Vega, you beautiful beast. There are also a couple of plot holes (and one big enough to fall into), but I was so focused on the *adorable* romance that I didn't really mind all that much.

.Game play.
What are you, new here? This is a visual novel. Click your mouse and read the text that appears. 

You can save and load at any point, barring when you're in the middle of making a decision, simply by pressing the right mouse button, which is handy. There's also a gallery for all of the CG you unlike by triggering events in the story or as part of the normal playthrough. 

You can play in full screen or windowed, though I preferred the latter because full screen gives you black bars on the sides.

.Soundtrack.
There was never a moment where I felt as though the music didn't suit what was going on in-game. Romantic scenes featured softer, slower tracks and fight scenes featured upbeat electronic scores. The background music kept me immersed in the story, never drawing away from what was happening, but also making what I read that much more memorable because it was so well-suited. 

Hell, I went to the store while playing to see if the store had the option to purchase the soundtrack separately.

-A minor gripe is that some of the sound effects used for things like gusts of wind and magical attacks sound a little hokey.

.Art style.
The game looks great. Kudos to whoever handled the art.  It's all done in a brightly-coloured anime style, and the backgrounds share the same feel. 

The main character's portrait, which is almost always presented in the bottom left corner of the screen, changes expression depending on what's being said. It's a nice touch and very well detailed. The other characters have a host of different positions and facial expressions that are cycled through, which is another nice touch to make them seem more than just some beautifully-rendered image.

-The backgrounds were pretty limited and, though the game takes place in a variety of settings, you only ever see the same series of images; i.e, the bits where you're at school utilize the same image of the woods that you see when you're at home. Again, this is minor. The backgrounds were still nice to look at, it was just a matter of taking a moment to ground myself in what setting the action had moved to.

.Characters.

There are eight main ones who get detailed portraits. Everone else is just a name on the screen. The cast is varied without fulfilling too many over-used tropes like the emo pretty boy or the girl who wants his attention. Not a single character was annoying, which I find tends to happen a lot with this kind of game. That's a major plus.

Characters include demons, humans, and a wyvern. His name is Sid. He's adorable.

Again, not much to be said here without spoiling anything.

.Bottom line.
If you're in the market for a visual novel, this is definitely worth your money. The game looks good, it's well-written, and you'll get multiple playthroughs out of it. I adore this game. It's one of the better visual novels I've played on Steam; I'm only stopping here because it's very late at night. 

Needless to say, I'm hooked. I whole-heartedly give this game my recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152923869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1461965039}
review:
From the start, I'd just like to say this game is very good. I played it all day long and it was a nice break from life XD. Though there are some things that might be a bit off, Starlight Vega is a very enjoyable visual novel. Now onto the review 

Story 
I find the story to have some very strong points but also some weak ones. The story overall is very interesting from the book, to how Lyria became trapped in stone, and the curse plaguing Vega. My problem though (and this depends on the route) is that thehe story can be weak at times. I think the story stayed pretty strong in Lyria's route. Not only do you find out who Aria's grandpa is, but you also get to know how Lyria came to be in the stone. Same goes for Melody's route to. Where it falls weak though is when we get to the curse and the book itself at times. I sometimes felt like the curse put on Vega wasn't shown enough and wished to feel more of that dread. I admit in Scherza's route that the curse is a bit better played out, but it kind of ends just like that. Still the story was written well and I will give major kudos to how the creator handle the intimate scenes. 

Characters 

One of the best parts of the game and they are what hold the story together. I'll give my thoughts on all of the main five. 

Aria- Our main character. She is an average yet interesting girl who is put into a tough situation. I'll say Aria is pretty likable. She has a personality and tries her best to deal with all these new things thrown at her. I admit sometimes I kind of wish she had more of a spark, but for what we got I did enjoy her and she made the romance feel true with the girls. 

Lyria- I think the best girl. From the moment I saw her I really did enjoy her personality and flirtatious, yet sometimes forceful attitude. Her route I believe was the strongest and I felt Aria and she were the best match. What I liked most about her route was the pacing with the romance. It felt very genuine and the pair had good chemistry. Also her story felt the most complete and I kind of wish the bad guy was in all of the routes since it made more sense. If I had to pick something I didn't like....well I can't think of it XD. Lyria was really a good and well thought out character. My fav to. 

Melody- Aria's best friend. From the moment I saw this girl's design I knew what she'd be like and I was right. Now don't get me wrong, Melody is a good character and the type of friend I'd want. I admit though she was the most boring of the three, but don't get me wrong, I still liked her character. Her love and care for Aria was really sweet and though I found her route to be the less interesting of the three, I did care for her. Only thing is I think she'd be better as a friend to Aria, but that's just me. Her route was cute though and she really has some beautiful CG's

Scherza-I'll admit, I was a bit surprised by this character. I knew she'd be the cold demon and some may find her not too likable. However Scherza, especially in her own route, shows a great deal of sadness and loneliness through the story due to the events in the past. What surprised me even more was she wasn't a Tsun type character despite being cold. In fact I really felt for the girl in all the routes. Her relationship with Aria was done pretty well to and that last CG in her route is pretty amazing. I did feel like Scherza was the second best matched for Aria to. Some points I didn't like about her route was how sometimes it felt rushed. Though the curse is touched upon more and you do feel sorry for Vega, I wished that it was a bit longer to show more of the problem Vega was facing But the creator did do a good job with pacing in her route, so it's not that big of a problem 

Sid- At first I hated this little guy, but he does grow on you. I can't say much without spoiling anything, but I'll tell you that you will feel sorry for him as you read. 

Art

Art is Starlight Vega is very good. I love how the sprites have  unique style. I admit I wish they had some more outfit variations. It was odd to go from sprites and then to CGs where the girls are wearing something entirely different. Still the sprites are very well done. 

CGs are exceptional. Every single one was done very well and I'll tell you I'll be looking back at them XD. If you can save them do, because Razz did an awesome job. 


Backgrounds are pretty good to. I admit some are better then others, but I never got put off by any. I think the demon castle had some of the best backgrounds. I do think that the castle bed rooms needed just small variations as well, but that's a minor thing. 

Music 

Music is good. Some songs may be a bit off putting, but overall the track was nice hearing. I never turned it off.

Closing Notes 

Starlight Vega is a very good and  fun visual novel. It's the first one I've played straight through in a while. The characters, art and story are overall great and I thank the creator for doing a GxG visual novel that can be enjoyed by all people and not just a certain group. Another thing I appreciate is how she handled the intimate scenes. They are done very well and I feel like if she did a more adult game she'd handle them well. 

Anyway if you're looking for a fun, pure GxG, romance story this is it. The price is far and I think you'll have a good time reading it I know I did =). 

Rating-8/10

Great from start to finish, strong story narrative that keeps you glued to the screen the art work and sprite management is top notch, and matches what is portrayed on the screen. The BGM is good and in and does not overpower the story but compliments it.  Play through time is about 4-6 hours depending on how fast you read. The choices are timed well and keeps the reader involved in the story and decision making process.

For a new indie developer Razz did an exceptional job that  should make the Japanese big budget VNs take notice.

With that said there were a couple of typo and grammar errors which does happen in all VNs but nothing that would detract from the story itself.
